intro: Galium javanicum, commonly known as the Java bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite leaves that are usually hairy. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Galium javanicum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
